etymology.description: 胳(胳) (gē, "arm") and 膊(膊) (bó, "arm"). The characters together emphasize the meaning of "arm." This is a compound where both parts refer to the same body part, reinforcing its identity.
etymology.interpretation: The word 胳膊 (gēbo) combines two characters both denoting 'arm,' forming a term specifically for this part of the body. This is an example of lexical reinforcement commonly found in Chinese.

examples.chinese: 我的胳膊被撞伤了(我的胳膊被撞傷了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de gēbo bèi zhuàng shāng le.
examples.english: My arm was injured in an accident.

examples.chinese: 运动时他胳膊疼(運動時他胳膊疼)，不得不休息(不得不休息)。
examples.pinyin: Yùndòng shí tā gēbo téng, bùdébù xiūxí.
examples.english: During exercise, his arm hurt, so he had to rest.
